poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: This one sagged into gravity, Snagged on a thorn. Sad It's scarred for life. Roses reared and sparred on a breath of breeze Sparrows slagged each other off. Car door slammed. A masked man Got stabbed outside a shop. Tinned beans were scarce But who'd have starved? The sinner Salved his scabbed and crottled conscience: He should have scrammed when tellt, But that's him slabbed. A skald Scanned the foreshore, spanned the firth and starred The north, its soggy strand, a stricken Stand of pine. Water running out and, Through his fingers, sand.
